author: dhpokers
title: No more rug pull
description: NFT developers are over promising on their road map to gain interest from investors and attempting rug pull to steal money from people.

f6_assessments.q0: There are a lot of cheaters in the world of NFTs. The aim is to build a community platform where NFT builders can reveal their identities. This platform makes sure that no scammers come on it. The platform may also reveal scammers. There is insufficient explanation in this proposal on how the creator can fully expose the scammers. There is a goal in the proposal, but it does not say in detail how this goal will be achieved. It can only add value to the Cardano ecosystem if all makers of NFTs sign up for it. However, this is only possible if all creators are obliged to do so.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no evidence that the maker can realize this project. The creator is a software developer and is currently alone. It would be better to make the creator known and to share relevant experiences. The creator is not clear about how many people are left to join the team. The maker should write in his proposal what type of people he is looking for to work on this project. No clear cost estimate has been made. The very general costs are described. There is nothing in it about how many working hours are needed to do this. The price seems quite high to me for this project to succeed. The time span to complete this project seems sufficient to me. A clear implementation plan has not yet been drawn up. It should be more clearly formulated how the makers will achieve everything. There is no clear explanation about the technical aspects of this project. The challenges and risks of this project have not been considered. This proposal should provide a better detailed description of how the makers can make this project as a working whole.
f6_assessments.q2: This project should first be worked out more clearly. There is a need for a complete team to support this project. There is no detailed roadmap stating where the makers want to be in the short and long term. The proposal will first have to be worked out in much more detail. Everything is very abstract.

f6_assessments.q0: From my knowledge of the cryptocurrency scene, I agree that the situation of rug pulling has been going on for quite some time ever since the blooming of cryptocurrency, reaching its climax in 2021. And the ugly consequence is when a developer flees his project with the investors’ money, that damages the revenue of the investors and followers and the integrity of the project, resulting in decreasing amount of trust within the community. Therefore, this unique yet necessary project should in theory restore that trust and at the same time appeal former and new users to join/rejoin Cardano, matching the challenge objective as well. And to reinforce that statement further, there is a list of actions provided by the proposer to tell us exactly what methods are taken into account to deal with this problem, kudos on my part. The only slight imperfection that I notice is the fact that while it makes sense that the problem of project title may compromise the creation of the project, the author has yet stated an effective solution to eliminate the threat. I assume that the proposer did consider a name change, yet it might not be that easy to come up with a plausible one.
f6_assessments.q1: From the given road map, I have confidence that the project will be finished and met with the support of the community. Extra praise on my part given that the project is planned to carry on for better quality in the future. What I find impressive in this section is that the proposer claims to be working alone, which goes to show that this person is highly experienced and resourceful, even though more members might join the project in the future. Personally, I think that this section would be more convincing if the proposer added more information on his background and expertise, along with some visual evidence to back up the claims. That being said, I believe the proposer has justified well enough for me to say the demanded budget is acceptable
f6_assessments.q2: In terms of clarity, the project does hold a certain level of it since the proposer promises to allow progress tracking with the help of GitHub. And I am sure that the desired outcome of the project aligns with the challenge setting, since it includes the adoption of users and partnerships with NFTs stores and developers, while making Cardano a safer and more trustworthy cryptocurrency blockchain to invest time and effort in.

f6_assessments.q0: The functionality of  this project has a positive effect on the Cardano ecosystem, by building trust with users, thereby increasing the number of transactions and new users. However, the author didn't go deeper into specific features. As the given risk of unwillingness to provide real life identify, what is the plan to solve it? Moreover, it is necessary to have more detailed and specific plans on information authentication, such as how to determine the information of NFT developers, are required. What types of documents are accepted? In addition, because this platform will perform as a third party, it is necessary to have a clear plan to ensure information security. Then what are the actions to take if a hacking or rug pulling problem arises? Is there any compensation or legal liability? And one of the advantages of smart contracts is cost savings and there are a group of people already have faith in it, so how to convince users or investors that funding for this project is reasonable?
f6_assessments.q1: The author has a strategy, but it is not clearly specified how to carry it out; the technical side is not presented or described well. The provided budget corresponds to the planned plan, however because the plan is still not clear and thorough, the budget suffers from the same issue. I recommend that the author properly outline all duties step by step, along with definite timeframes or a road map. The team should also submit a detailed budget breakdown, such as how many individuals they want to recruit? How many hours must they work every week? For how long? What is the pay rate? Are there any key performance indicators (KPIs) or deadlines in place to assess work quality? How do you persuade someone to join you in business? What marketing channels do you intend to use? The author has not provided particular information to verify, such as a LinkedIn profile. So, in addition to deciding more suitability from experience and quality to enhance delivery project capabilities, we will require more information to promote authenticity. Meanwhile, the author failed to address the estimated number of remaining team members, which may result in a delay in recruiting, an increase in team maintenance costs, and a overruns implementation time. For all of the reasons stated above, this project does not meet our feasibility expectations.
f6_assessments.q2: To measure project progress, clear metrics are required. Furthermore, the community will ask for particular reporting channels on the rising number of users and traffic on the project's website, allowing forecasts about the growth of Cardano's network and ADA usage. Other issues, such as delays, should be highlighted as well. The author's success vision demonstrates that he or she is pretty clear about the mission; nonetheless, it still needs a lot of clear case studies or research to determine that this is a project with high clarity.

To address this issue, they plan to establish a community platform that teaches and informs people about crypto in general, as well as the various projects that are now taking place in the crypto universe. I'd just like to know if it's feasible to refer to the number of proposals under the KPI and Metrics section using real figures. Although I expect this will be difficult.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal timeline and milestones and clearly outlined, the proposer has allocated the time into 4 quarters.  The roadmap is very detailed and provides clarity on what will be developed within a quarter, and it seems realistic to what is being proposed. The budget seems appropriate. The budget requested though is detailed and very specific, is kind of conservative, I foresee that some costs are going to be higher than what is outlined in the proposal, I do remain confident that the project will be done anyway, but it would've been better to request a proper amount that doesn't create doubts on that front. However, having the proposer take on this challenge alone can present some difficulties, so I encourage you to find more experienced partners to form a team that is strong and knowledgeable enough to carry out this plan
f6_assessments.q2: For the most part, the primary measures are not quantitative, but the success criteria are appropriate. To improve the challenge, better define how the success criteria address the problem and how the measurements can track progress toward the goal.

f6_assessments.q0:
Although the NFT space is comparatively young, the community has seen and experienced many “rug pulls” in which projects promise an amazing product (e.g. with CNFT/NFT feature/functionality), but at the end don’t deliver anything. So far, many people have been scammed and rug pulls can and will happen in the Cardano ecosystem sooner or later (few have actually already happened). The author himself/herself has been a victim of such a scam and with this proposal wants to the address this problem. The author aims to create a platform where people can be educated about NFTs and other crypto related topics. The most interesting feature will be the time-locked identity functionality. NFT creators can submit their project and their identity and set a predetermined date on which their identity will be revealed to the public. With this, the author wants to ensure the authenticity of NFT projects and make sure that frauds can be brought to justice in case they try to scam people. Having such a website could reduce the amount of rug pulls in the CNFT ecosystem and could enhance the trust in CNFTs and the community. 

Although these aspects are beneficial to the Cardano ecosystem, this proposal is not addressing how gamers in particular will be attracted and onboarded. As this proposal is more generally addressing CNFTs (and scams associated with it) and not games or gamers, it is not effectively aligning with the challenge. Therefore, I am giving 1 star.
f6_assessments.q1:
The author provides a rough plan, but no detailed timeline or roadmap is given. The final point “5. Project continues” is vague and shows that there is no long-term vision. A budget breakdown is provided but the requested funds are unreasonably high for this category in this Catalyst round. The proposer should consider reducing the requested budget to increase the chance of getting funded. The team only consists of the author himself/herself who has 10+ years experience in software development. As this project will involve creating smart contracts and other blockchain features, developers with the respective capabilities will need to be hired. Since a good core team is currently missing, it would have been important to provide additional information about the hiring process (skillsets, experience). 

As there are several open points in the proposal (no plan with detailed milestones and blockchain developers are missing in the core team) I don’t think this proposal will be implemented successfully in the stated time frame (12 months from starting date).
f6_assessments.q2:
To measure the progress of the development, the number of Github commits shall be considered. However, no link to the Github repository was provided. Additionally, no information is given whether reports or developmental updates will be shared with the community. Furthermore, no detailed roadmap with milestones is included, making it challenging to track the development of the proposal and determine its current state.
To measure the success, the author suggests several metrics. Unfortunately, for none of them detailed numbers were given. Without actual numbers or (at least) estimates, the success cannot be measured appropriately. Moreover, stating “Adoption by general people” is simply too vague. Instead, the author should have highlighted what number of users he/she is aiming for at the end of the project.
Altogether, the information given is not sufficient to audit the progress and success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers aim at developing a platform to verify the identity of the developer team of NFT projects to avoid rug pulls. The idea is to protect their identity and at some point in the future reveal it, or reveal if they rug pull the project. To me it makes some sense, but I didn’t understand why does it have a future to reveal only in the future, at a set date. If it’s going to be revealed at some point, for trust it’s better to reveal since the beginning. If it was only a matter of verifying their identity and reveal only in case of rug pull, it would make more sense to me. Also, I don’t know why the proposers limited this to NFTs, because it could also work for fungible tokens. The proposal is only barely aligned with the challenge, because they mention the NFTs could be modified to add some gaming functionally, for example. But I don’t think it’s really aligned with any of the challenge goals and metrics. They mention as risk that the developers might not want to identify their identity since the beginning, which is true, but could be used as something positive: if this project is successful and secure, there’s basically no reason for project to be verified through it.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposing team presents a high level roadmap, with one milestone per quarter for one year. It is not very detailed, and some points should be explained. For example: how is this platform going to be like? Why is it not enough to use another 3rd platform such as Discord or Reddit? They mention that they are going to connect this platform to smart contracts, but it’s not explained how this is going to work as well. Therefore, it’s not possible to also evaluate the proposed budget, since they only present lump sums for each of the milestones. There’s no explanation about the team members that are going to work in each part and their hourly or monthly cost. The proposer also mentions that currently he’s the only one in the team, and he’s going to look for a couple more devs, what adds some risk to the project, and there’s no information about the proposer background. All the mentioned information should be added here to increase the project’s feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer doesn’t add enough information to be able to assess the auditability. They don’t say how the community can see the progress, besides github issues. Although, I don’t believe this is enough for tracking the whole project. Also, the success definition is very vague, they just say that they expect the project to be successful. They mention some KPIs to measure the proposal success, but there’s no metrics to really know if they are doing well or not. At last, it is stated that this is a new proposal, which is ok, doesn’t need to be verified.

f6_assessments.q0:
It is true that lots of crypto based NFT schemes are rug pulls and we need a solution to ensure more trust on the crypto market but This proposal will need to do more work to convince me about its impact to the cardano community.
 based are some of my concerns:
The proposal failed to describe its solution in clear terms nor did it bother to go into details about the technology (If Atala prism will be used for keeping the identity of the NFT creators ).
"The platform would also support burning of rug pulled NFTs and replace with new NFTS" - How is this going to be achieved without giving up private keys?

f6_assessments.q0: The goal of this project is to create a platform for educating the community on the potential risks on buying NFT and creating audibility and accountability for the NFT creator. Rug pulls has becoming a nuisance in the crypto space, leaving bad reputation and perception in society. While I agree to your idea of creating awareness and accountability to the developers, this proposal does not fit within this challenge. This challenge emphasizes on how to onboard gamers as well as game developers that is not exposed to crypto or Cardano to be specific. I suggest you move your proposal to miscellaneous challenge as it is better fit within that campaign.
f6_assessments.q1:
As your proposal demanded transparency from the NFT creators and developers, so does the voters and the community. There are no such verifiable information on your experience nor relevant skills on executing the project. You are advised to put a link of your linkedin profile or github repository to prove that you are capable to implement the project.
Furthermore, the resources and manpower needed to implement the project are vaguely presented. They must be presented in a detail and understandable manner for ease of assessment especially with such high amount of requested funds. The plans for implementing the proposal are also unclear. In the creating the community platform phase, how do you plan on building it? What are the rules and guidelines of using your platform? How do you make sure that the developers who registered on your platform is not a scammer? What is the criteria? It is also stated in your proposal that your platform will support burning rugpulled NFT's to a new NFT. How does that work? What kind of NFT will be replaced instead? How can you make it sustainable? More information on every phase of your project will be beneficial so it can be better assessed.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria of this proposal are unclear. It is best to state in details on how many people that you aim on using the platform. As the roadmap presented does not include any dates on when each step will implemented, so it might difficult to track progress on a monthly basis. Moreover, there is no information on where the voters can keep track of the progress of your work for auditability. Therefore, the proposal should include, for a future submission, more details on how the progress would be tracked in a smaller timeframe and also where the voters can keep track of the progress of your project.

f6_assessments.q0: Given the high requested funding of this project, the lack of any reasonable justification for it is unacceptable.  It seems like someone spent 5 minutes making this proposal.  There is no planning or timeline.  In addition, while nobody likes a rugpull, this system of demanding KYC from developers seems useless.  If they wanted to identify themselves, there are ways to do so, and the consumer should take this into consideration before purchasing.  It would be nice to have a solution but this IMO is not it.
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer claims to be a software developer with 10+ years experience but cites nothing they have done in the past or anything to indicate this would be a success.
f6_assessments.q2: There is nothing here except vague notions of the NFT community adopting the system.

f6_assessments.q0:
The purpose of this challenge is to attract more users and developers, making Cardano the go-to network for game development and consumption.
While this proposal attempts to combat a widespread evil in the NFT world, I believe that the impact is at least indirect since the prevention of rug pulls is very complex and to achieve it will require the development of standards and agreements in consensus by the entire community, quite a difficult task.
I consider that an educational platform is a good advance to help prevent this evil but taking into account the objective of the challenge, even if this proposal were a resounding success it would not help to attract players and developers on a massive scale.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proponent starts from a bad personal experience in the NFT world, and it is commendable that he seeks to prevent others from being scammed, however he does not demonstrate experience in site development, educational experiences, or community building, all very important aspects to achieve the success of the proposal in question based on the stated objectives.
There is no mention of the team that will work on the proposal, so it is difficult to understand if the proposed timelines are adequate or if this plan will be executed by a single person.
The roadmap does not sufficiently detail the tasks and milestones necessary to consider this proposal successful in a 12-month period. On the other hand, almost 25% of the funds allocated to this challenge are requested, but there is no breakdown of how the resources will be used to achieve the goal.
Given the above, I consider it unlikely that this proposal can be successfully executed.
f6_assessments.q2:
Unfortunately no clear or achievable metrics are provided but only some vague criteria. In order to make a correct measurement some valid KPI´s would be:
- X number of partnerships with NFT projects achieved.
- X number of people in the community of X social network.
-Adoption of at least X% of the general community of the platform and its functionalities. 

In this way the evaluators would have some rails to guide them in assessing the success of this project, and if for example it would be advisable to allocate funds to a continuation of it.

Given the information available, I believe it will be extremely difficult to evaluate and follow up on this initiative.

solution: Build a platform that educates people, locks NFT developers identity to be revealed in fixed date and replaces rug pulled NFTs.
experience:
First NFT investment was a rug pull and second one is taking the same direction.
It seems people have accepted rug pull as the part of crypto journey. Projects can fail however project started with bad intentions should be identified and prevented to build more trust in crypto.
